results.title: The Challenge of leadership
results.brief_description: Illustrates how leadership arises naturally in a critical situation. Helps supervisor identify and discuss the qualities that make a leader and the skills used in applying leadership by voluntary consent of the group.

results.title: The Challenge of change
results.brief_description: This video with accompanying trainer’s manual sets out to provide participants undertaking the training program with the knowledge and skills which will enable them to fully understand the impact, both positive and negative, of significant change in their work situation and how this impact may affect their interpersonal relationships both at work and in their family and social life.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: John Carter, Gil Brealey and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: This film deals with a situation in which one man is promoted over an another who has more experience in the same area. The man overlooked displays his resentment by insisting that nothing has changed and that he will continue to behave as he has always done. The question posed concerns the preservation of old relationships after promotion while making it clear that one is now boss. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: Tony Doogood and Victoria. Dept. of Agriculture
results.brief_description: The factors which have contributed to Victoria’s progress: wheat and sheep; agricultural experiments; mining; dam-building and hydro-electric power; irrigation combatting erosion; bringing infertile land into production. The strength of Victoria’s economy lies in increasing food production.

results.title: The Challenge
results.creator_credit: Rentokil Film Unit and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Describes the history of the origin of the rat. Discusses the methods used to avoid rat infestation, whilst also describing the rats’ habits, and habitation. Essentially a propaganda film for the company Rentokil.

results.title: The Chalice
results.creator_credit: Shevard Goldstein, Bryant Ewing and Ultramedia Productions
results.brief_description: Set in some affluent, edwardian part of the United States, a father congratulates his son on graduating from Harvard. The father soberly points out to the son that a certain tradition must follow, a tradition dating back through the family, a tradition dating back to Sir Charles. The son must drink from a chalice.. This short film is a forgotten masterpiece of climax comedy. Written by L.James Herbert and edited by Gregory Pike.

results.title: The Chain Reaction
results.creator_credit: Ian Barry, Ross Matthews and Palm Beach Pictures
results.brief_description: A thriller in which a married couple are thrown into a world of terror, after being contaminated with radioactivity. Cast includes Steve Bisley, Hugh Keays-Byrne, Lorna Lesley. Photography by Nixon Binney.

results.title: The Chain gang
results.creator_credit: A Zegenhagen and English, Scottish and Australian Bank Film Unit
results.brief_description: Training film for bank tellers, aiming to foster customer loyalty by making the customer feel welcome, important and at ease. The chain of branches is 500 strong and each individual bank throughout Australia is important as a link in the chain. Personal attention is shown to be vital in the formation of the customer’s image of the bank.

results.title: The Centre
results.creator_credit: J.B. Holmes, Paul Rotha and Films of Fact
results.brief_description: The Pioneer Health Centre in Peckham was one of the first community health centres in England. This film shows the facilities and follows a family who join the Centre. The father and young son enjoy the Centre’s activities, however, the mother is less impressed because the Centre’s thorough medical check revealed that she needs to undergo surgery. The mother is gradually won over as she regains her health through the Centre’s facilities.
